organic_results.title: On feeling good about oneself: Practical ideology in schools of choice
organic_results.snippet: There is probably no single concept currently generating more discussion in the field of sociology of education than ideology (Apple, 1979; Giroux, 1981; Karabel and Halsey, 1979; Sharp, 1980). Despite the currency of the concept, few terms are as inconsistently used, illdefined, and often-times vacuous as ideology. Indeed, the term has been given various definitions:(1)" maps of problematic social reality and matrices for the creation of collective conscience"(Geertz, 1964: 64);(2) a" system of belief; a set of values serving mainly as a …
